result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner J. Keeser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:

--Absolute sobriety (No possession/consumption of alcohol, No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)

--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--DNA Sample and Surcharge
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF90 & 15CF120 called together at 11:25 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tanner J. Keeser in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF90 - On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the on or near enhancer on Count #2

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2 & Count #3-15CF90 & Counts #1, #7 & #8-15CF120; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in 15CF90 & 15CF120

15CF90 - on Count #2: Court sentences Mr. Keeser to 3.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence in being & concurrent to 15CF120

15CF120 - on Count #1: Court sentences Mr. Keeser to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to 15CF90 & consecutive to any other sentence in being 

BOTH CASES: The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision as listed on criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment
--Absolute sobriety (No possession/consumption of alcoho, No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Random drug & alcohol screens
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay costs to include agency drug testing fees
--DNA Sample and Surcharge
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent

Court orders that costs on all misdemeanor charges be entered into civil judgment rather than part of ES as listed on criminal case settlement

On Count #3-15CF90, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--Serve 20 days jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to Count #2-15CF90 & 15CF120

On Count #7-15CF120, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--Serve 20 days jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to Counts #1 & #8-15CF120 & 15CF90

On Count #8-15CF120, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--Serve 20 days jail, to be served in the prison system, concurrent to Counts #1 & #7-15CF120 & 15CF90

The Court gives 62 days credit for time already served-15CF120
The Court gives 48 days credit for time already served-15CF90

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

Cases 15CF90 and 15CF120 called together at 9:36am
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Tanner J. Keeser in court, in custody with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to 15CF90:
Atty. Zarwell acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint and waives reading

On the States Motion for Bail Modification:
--No objection from Defense

The Court modifies the bond to $1000 cash with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--not to drive a vehicle with out a valid driver's license


As to 15CF90 and 15CF120:   
Mr. Keeser waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted on both cases, reading waived as to both
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on both cases
recess: 9:41am

Defendant Tanner J. Keeser in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies the Mr. Keeser's birthdate and address on file.
The Court inquires about Mr. Kesser's desire to obtain counsel.
Mr. Keeser states he does wish for counsel representation.
The Court directs Mr. Keeser to go to the PD office immediately this morning and then report back to the Court.
